result.execSummary:
The defendant Colton J. Hancock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Court finds defendant eligible for CIP & SAP as soon as statutorily eligible.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant must pay restitution.
Joint and several.
Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.
Obtain or maintain full time employment after release.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample on 10-6-2015.
Pay DNA surcharge -   can be taken from up to 25% of prison monies.

No contact with co-defendant, L.P.
No contact with J.D., P.D., H.S., B.A. or their immediate families.
No contact with Capri Motel.
Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.
Defendant not to consume or possess any prescription medication without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
No contact with any known drug users except NA or AA.
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare as determined by agent.

records.addlTxt: of Court to release PSI to Outagamie County

Defendant Colton J. Hancock in court with attorney Jane Krueger Smith.  Defendant Colton J. Hancock in custody.  Allen R Brey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court approves restitution
DA spks on sentencing
Atty Smith spks on sentencing
Def addresses the court
Court imposes:
Ct 2: 5 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision. Consecutive to any other sentence. 89 days credit. Eligible for CIP & SAP as soon as statutorily eligible.
Ct 3: 5 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision. Concurrent to Ct 2.
Def must submit DNA sample on 10-6-15
Def must pay $250 DNA surcharge- can be taken from up to 25% of prison monies
Def must pay restitution- joint and several
No contact with co-def, L.P
No contact with J.D. and P.D, H.S, B.A or their immediate families. No contact with Capri Motel.
Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders. 
Def not to consume or possess any prescription medication without a valid prescription. All prescriptions shall be verified by your agent.
No contact with any known drug users except NA or AA
Obtain or maintain full-time employment after release
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare as determined by agent
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Def remains in custody for transport
Appeal rights
